question: How can I reserve a book / DVD / Video?
answer:
Only if the needed book/DVD/video is checked out (on-loan), you may reserve it through the Library Catalog.
To reserve a book/DVD/video please follow the below steps:
Search for the needed item in the Library Catalog
If the item is on-loan (DUE_date), click on the top left: Hold this item
You will be prompted to enter your username and password to access your personal library account.
Once logged in, select again the item, and choose the location you want to pick it from, and click on "Request Selected".
A pop-up window will open confirming the request, click on "OK".
When the item becomes available, you will receive an e-mail notice from the library. The item will be held for you at the Circulation desk for 2 days.
For more information, contact the Circulation desk by email: libcirc@aub.edu.lb or by phone 01-350000 Ext. 2618.

question: Rent a book / DVD / Video
answer:
Only if the needed book/DVD/video is checked out (on-loan), you may reserve it through the Library Catalog.

Search for the needed item in the Library Catalog
If the item is on-loan (DUE_date), click on the top left: Hold this item
You will be prompted to enter your username and password to access your personal library account.
Once logged in, select again the item, and choose the location you want to pick it from, and click on "Request Selected".
A pop-up window will open confirming the request, click on "OK".
When the item becomes available, you will receive an e-mail notice from the library. The item will be held for you at the Circulation desk for 2 days.
For more information, contact the Circulation desk by email: libcirc@aub.edu.lb or by phone 01-350000 Ext. 2618.

question: How do I cite my sources?
answer: Kindly access our How to Cite your Sources research guide to learn more about citation, citation styles, auto-citation machines, bibliographic tools, plagiarism and academic integrity.

question: Resources or guidelines to help me write a manuscript for my completed thesis? Are there any resources or guidelines to help me write a manuscript for my completed thesis? I am planning on publishing my study and was wondering if there are any guidelines or resources to assist me in writing my manuscript.
answer:
To publish your thesis as an article, first you need to adapt the content to fit the style of an article, and second you need to select the journal in which you will be publishing, then write the article. Each journal has its own rules and guidelines in terms of layout and referencing.
Check the following article for some tips, as well as this guide.
There is also this article from Elsevier that you might find helpful.

question: Are there any fines on overdue items?
answer:
Overdue fines are 1$ per day for any library item.
For any unpaid fine, you will receive up to three email notices from the library until fines are paid. After these notices, if fines are not paid, they:
will be added to your Statement of Fees (Student).
will be deducted from your salary at the end of the month (Staff).
If you have further questions, check the following link:
https://www.aub.edu.lb/Libraries/Services/Pages/Students.aspx (Student)
https://www.aub.edu.lb/Libraries/Services/Pages/Faculty.aspx (Faculty)

question: Can I access online resources from off-campus?
answer:
To access licensed library resources from off-campus, you need a valid AUBnet user ID and password. If you are an active AUB user, your AUBnet account is your email/Internet account (without the @aub.edu.lb).
For more information about off-campus access and system configuration please visit the Connect from Off-Campus section.
If the problem persists, please contact the Automation Department by phone 01-350000 ext. 2604 or by email: monassi@aub.edu.lb.

If the problem persists, please contact the Automation Department by phone 01-350000 ext. 2604 or by email: monassi@aub.edu.lb.

question: Why is the full-text of the article not available electronically?
answer:
We might not have the full-text of the article for the following reasons:
The library might not have a subscription to the electronic version of the journal.
The library might have a subscription to the electronic version of the journal, but not the volume in which the article appears in.
The publisher or distributor may not yet have all issues of the journal available online.
Technical problem
You may order the article by filling out this form.
For more information you may Chat with us, Ask-a-Librarian or email us at: jftref@aub.edu.lb

question: How do I access the full-text of an article?
answer:
Type the title of the article in question on the search bar on the library webpage.
In the search results page, if you locate the article and you find "Fulltext Online" under it, then you may click on it to access the article. If you find "Citation Online" then the article is not available in our collection.
Kindly note if you are off-campus, once you click on "Fulltext Online" it will redirect you to an ezproxy page requesting you to enter your AUB username & password. Once you do, you will have access to the article.

question: How do I borrow a book, and for how long?
answer:
You may borrow and return books at the Circulation Desk.
To borrow a book, locate it in the Library Catalog, get the Call No. and hand it to the Circulation Desk. Click on Borrower Categories for users privileges.
The library has open stacks service for faculty and graduate students who are expected to locate the needed books on their own. Circulation staff are available for help when needed.

question: How do I reserve a carrel?
answer:
Students writing their thesis should fill the form: Reserve a Carrel
N.B: Make sure to read the instructions first.
For further assistance please contact Mrs. Carla Chalhoub, Access Services Librarian, by email: cc05@aub.edu.lb or by phone: 01-350000 ext. 2619.

question: Is there any way to get access to books in the library? (for example in PDF format)
answer:
Kindly follow the steps below:
Go to the aub library webpage
Type the keyword in the main search box
On the results page, select "Books/ebooks" on the left side.
Once the results are limited, look for the e-book you need,
If you find it with "Full-text Online" then you can click on it and access the ebook
If you find "citation online" it means it is not accessible
If you find a call number such as "J 634.45:B948:c.1" it means the book is available in print at the library
If you don't find it in the results, then it is not available.
In the last three options, you can order a couple of chapters via the DDS Form.

question: How can I find what is on-Reserve for my class?
answer:
Print books of course materials are available at the Circulation Desk.
For materials posted electronically, go to Course Reserve, located under the search box of the Library webpage and look for the course, for example: MATH-201 (password is obtained from the professor/ if needed).
Previous exams are posted electronically and can be retrieved as well.
For additional help, please look at a sample search.

question: How can I renew borrowed books?
answer:
You are responsible for renewing your materials, in person, at the Circulation Desk in the libraries or online, after clearing any outstanding fines and overdue items.
For Online Renewal go to My Library Account enter your AUBnet account and password (email account/password).​​ You can only renew online twice.
F​​or more details on renewals, ​​​​​​​​​​recall, and lost or damaged items​ check here, or contact the Circulation desk at ext. 2618 or send an email to libcirc@aub.edu.lb.

question: Do you have any genealogy resources to help Lebanese emigrants obtain info about their family origins?
answer:
You can have a look at our Genealogy Research Guide where you will find useful links and resources.
However, please keep in mind that it is very difficult to track down information about Lebanese genealogy unless there are specific details related to the person/family (political stance, prominent relatives, events, etc.).
The best way to find information is usually via the notary/municipality of the area in which they lived or the religious center of their area of residence.

question: How can I locate the databases?
answer:
To access the library databases, kindly follow the below steps:
Go to Libraries from the top menu bar
Click on databases under the search bar.
You can look for a database according to its title (from the A-Z list) or subject (by choosing one from the "Find Resources by Subject" drop menu).
